name: Muquim Ahmed
content:
Muquim Ahmed (born 1 September 1954) is a Bangladeshi-born British entrepreneur.[1] He is thought to be the first Brick Lane[2] millionaire.[citation needed]
 Ahmed arrived in East London in the early 1970s, aged 19, to study Engineering with the intention of returning to join the family business in Bangladesh.[3]
 Having invested £2 million in a bakery and a ready meals factory in South West London, Ahmed, 55, is building a food manufacturing leg to his property and restaurant portfolio. Best known for his work in transforming the Brick Lane area of East London, later helped his father export goods from Britain and the Netherlands to Bangladesh. He diversified into property and was a millionaire at 26. He has a £30m property portfolio while his Café Naz chain of restaurants turns over about £3.5 million a year. His other interests include a travel agency.[3]
 Ahmed is also a fellow of The University of London.[3]
 
 This article about a British businessperson born in the 1950s is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.

raw:
Muquim AhmedBorn (1954-09-01) 1 September 1954 (age 66)Sylhet District, East Bengal, Pakistan (now Bangladesh)NationalityBritishEducationProduction EngineeringOccupationEntrepreneurNotable workCafé Naz restaurants
Muquim Ahmed (born 1 September 1954) is a Bangladeshi-born British entrepreneur.[1] He is thought to be the first Brick Lane[2] millionaire.[citation needed]

Contents

1 Biography
2 See also
3 References
4 External links


Biography[edit]
Ahmed arrived in East London in the early 1970s, aged 19, to study Engineering with the intention of returning to join the family business in Bangladesh.[3]
Having invested £2 million in a bakery and a ready meals factory in South West London, Ahmed, 55, is building a food manufacturing leg to his property and restaurant portfolio. Best known for his work in transforming the Brick Lane area of East London, later helped his father export goods from Britain and the Netherlands to Bangladesh. He diversified into property and was a millionaire at 26. He has a £30m property portfolio while his Café Naz chain of restaurants turns over about £3.5 million a year. His other interests include a travel agency.[3]
Ahmed is also a fellow of The University of London.[3]
